page.title: 18Sedge basketmaking Lparish.
page.content: The only person thought to make{sedge {baskets}in Hants.lives in Lparish. She has been making these baskets for 35 years. {The sedge is cut by sickle from the {riverside in July,}tied in small bundles,raked, sorted and hung in a shed to mature.The sedge would lose its colour if it was dried in the sun.In the winter the baskets are made.First,the lady ties 7'straws'at one end and hooks the string over a nail in the roof beam of her cottage. She{plaits the straws}until she has a length of 12 metres.This is then } sewn into a circle using a sail needle and raffia.Other lengths are sewn on and eased into the shape required. A medium-sized basket takes two evenings to make,a log basket takes a month.
